website_summaries.verdict: The best value family tent available right now. Coleman now offers a rain fly for this tent, and its floor space and quick setup means it's good for both individuals and families.
pros: This tent has a top height of 6'5" and can sleep up to 8 people
It is easy to set up and comes with a carry bag
cons: The tent may not be completely waterproof
Zippers may stick or break after a few years of heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Buy separate stakes and USE THE GUY LINES.
customer_reviews.text: Two very important things. READ THIS. 1. Buy better stakes. Seriously. The ones that come with this tent are awful. Absolutely will not hold well in damp soil. 2. The guy lines are CRITICAL to the structural integrity of the tent. (6 cords attached to the tent? Those are guy lines.) I'm seeing pictures and reviews showing slumped tents and the darn guy line cords are still wrapped up and not used. TIE THOSE BABIES DOWN! They hold up your tent against wind, rain, etc. It's a quick setup tent and it's so far been amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Nice size tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice size tent! We used for our queen size mattress and still plenty of room for a pack and play and luggage. Felt very spacious for camping. I'd say a realistic number is like 6 people, although we used it for 4 and it was very comfortable. Setup was super easy, even for an inexperienced camper like myself. I didnt really need to read directions, it was self-explanatory. Having an extra hand to help set it up helped a LOT but I dont think it would be impossible to setup on your own. I was able to break it down all on my own. For the size it's pretty compact when all folded up. Def would recommend
customer_reviews.author: J V

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for car camping
customer_reviews.text: I like that this tent is roomy for a family of four; I am 6' tall and can stand up and walk around. This tent did really well on a camping trip with three days of non-stop rain, it wasn't bone dry, the walls were wet to the touch, but the bedding and clothes remained dry. The tent is easy to put up, when you follow the directions. The directions are stitched in the tent bag and on the tent hub. I would recommend it to a friend. Improvements to the tent: a covered entrance way for when it is raining an access hole for an extension cord hooks or nylon loops on the ceiling to hang lights and stuff
customer_reviews.author: kix

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tent up since the day I bought it and it is holding up well in wind and light monsoon rain. We have not had any truly heavy monsoon rain this year, so I can't speak to that, but it has held up well for how long I have had it up (well over a month, closer to 2 months). It has been used daily that entire time due to and interesting and tragic house situation. We have had strong winds and it has held up well in that as well, however- I do have some extra anchor lines to trees, so I do not know how well it would hold up without those.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: nice weather, no rain or wind
customer_reviews.text: First time to set it up, noticed two of the roof supports would not extend. Looking closer, the rods were/are installed upside down. Could not get them to extend at all, finally had to unscrew at the joint and install them correctly. One night in the tent, nice weather, no rain or wind. Upon taking the tent down one of the other properly installed roof supports would not collapse, end result with just a light bit of pressure trying to get it to collapse the rod bent and broke. Will be contacting Coleman to see what they can do about it, will post their response here. Very crappy product for 200 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Durham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent. Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This would be the third season with this tent. We are very happy with it. here are some of the things we like about it... Tent is roomy and good inside height. Can comfortably fit 8 people, with some room for a few bags Large windows that can be zipped to close Excellent water resistance : It rained for good 12-14 hours on our fist camping in this tent. We were all dry inside. Easy to setup and pack-up. With two people can set it up in 15 leisure minutes. Pack up gets done in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Luckily, I never got this tent anywhere near a campground. I set it up a grand total of twice, both times at home, in calm windless weather. On the second set-up the poles were so jammed as to make them nearly impossible to extend. After fighting with it for nearly an hour, we finally gave up, only to have one of the poles bend and, ultimately break during take-down. I have extensive experience setting up and taking down tents, this was, by far the most frustrating such experience I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Pixleyguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice interior layout but expensive and a terrible design
customer_reviews.text: OK, so the interior layout is great and setup is relatively simple and quick although the top extension poles tend to stick a bit and feel somewhat fragile. The big problem is taking it down, getting it rolled up and back into the bag. It takes forever and you really have to mash the fragile components together. Considering this difficulty, the average set-up / take-down is longer then much less expensive (non-instant) tents. Combine this issue with the facts that the tent is not waterproof and has a very high price and I have conclude that Coleman rushed a poor design to market. I’ll probably keep this tent but my next one will be waterproof, non-instant, and half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: good tent bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Once you get all the bugs worked out it's not a bad tent, 3 out of the 4 roof poles were assembled wrong I need to remove the screw in each one and rotate half of the pole so the latch would line up with the hole in the larger half of the pole, also one of the knuckles was installed upside down, plus I ordered a Brown tent but received a Black one, no time to return since they are out of stock now and campground is reserved. P.s. you need 2 people to set it up unless you tie off each corner as you go or else it will keep falling over
customer_reviews.author: Scott Parry

customer_reviews.title: Good but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This tent is spacious enough to accommodate 2 queen beds and it still has a room to walk and for your other things. It also has a very good height as you can stand inside the tent in all corners. I like it, but the only issue that I have is that it is very heavy to carry for an elder person and it is very difficult to fold back to fit in the bag. I cant say about water proofing since it didn't rain during the 3 day camp.
customer_reviews.author: malkovic

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts!
customer_reviews.text: Had this tent for just over a year. The poles, especially the top roof pole froze up solid just after the second use. Guess what? Coleman does not offer replacement poles for this model! Just wasted a bunch of money that I could have spent on a much better tent!!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up! Our answer to pandemic distancing fir grandkid sleepovers.
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping last week and all I can say is "wow!": this is some tent for such a quick set up! We had loads of room for inflatable mattresses, backpacks, lanterns, etc. Found the flap dividing the inside to be very useful when I wanted to nap but my husband wanted to read or move about. Lots of windows for ventilation and light. Zipper tended to snag on the lining at the front door initially but then I learned how to hold it correctly. Bought the rain shield but didn't need to use it. We now plan to erect this in the backyard so our grandkids can still have their sleepovers even during a pandemic!
customer_reviews.author: pnw snowbird

customer_reviews.title: I love it, sort of...
customer_reviews.text: The rods did not slide open and close smoothly and I, had to use a bit of force get them to fully extend and then collapse. It seems to be getting easier, or so I hope. Other than that it is on the heavy side, definitely a car tent and not a hiking tent. Other than that I am very impressed! Fairly easy to set up and tear down. Large and spacious. I am 6-1 and can stand in the tent without issue. Window/Screens are plentiful and make sleep very comfortable, however rain enters tent unless all Windows/Screens are secure/closed up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Matzke

customer_reviews.title: Hmm
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing is heavy. Morning dew crept in without the added rain fly. With the rainfly. It was fine. It’s hard to put up. I thought you could leave them all connected but it pulls on others and makes poles crooked so you have to undo some first. Then reattach them. So I disconnect them to go in the tent. I’m happy except that it’s not as easy as my Coleman instant 4 man this does take 2-4 people to set up. So if it’s only 2. It will take time. Once set up it’s roomy. I still think I want to contact Coleman something doesn’t seem right with the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Kinko mom

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and kind of unwieldy to pack. Also don’t camp in extreme temperatures as this thing gets so hot even the lid of my Yeti cooler was heating up. However, it is spacious and with a good enough set of fans you won’t have too much trouble with the heat. I wish they’d make a big version of the 4-person sundome darkroom tent because that actually stayed cool.
customer_reviews.author: Muse M.

customer_reviews.title: The stakes that came with the tent are terrible, we had 20 mph winds all weekend on ...
customer_reviews.text: The stakes that came with the tent are terrible, we had 20 mph winds all weekend on a Boy Scout outing and the stakes kept pulling out of the ground, even after doubling up. We came back from a long hike and the tent was literally in a tree. Punctures in several places poles are bent and the tent is ruined on the 2nd use. My son and I ended up sleeping in the bed of my truck. I liked the tent but for something that size better stakes should be the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Bad - But Great Service From Coleman!!!
customer_reviews.text: Opened twice. First time - had to force it open and closed. Second time - same and then we threw it away. This is a bad product by Coleman. Bought it as a Christmas present in November. I doubt Coleman will replace, but we'll let them address the problem. We are experienced tenters with our 20-year tent still good. We'll get that out again! For instant owners, first-time out of the box, be sure your telescoping poles are not bent! Follow Up: Contacted Coleman. They are sending me a new tent. Fancy that!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie

customer_reviews.title: Modest wind blows it open
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent last month, along with some heavy duty pegs and a rainfly. I wanted to test it out for a few days before going anywhere with it, and I am relieved that I took the time to do so. In modest winds, this zippers in this tent BLOW OPEN, allowing rain to pour in. What's the point of a rainfly if it's unzipped? The thing heaved and swayed constantly, even with high-quality pegs. It swayed so much in the wind that two holes appeared where it brushed a bag inside. It's too late to return it, but this is going in the trash soon.
customer_reviews.author: J King

customer_reviews.title: Too many design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and put the tent up in my yard prior to going on a trip after reading some of the reviews. Couldn't live with the design flaws and inferior stitch quality in some areas, put it right back in the box and returned it the very same day. The lack of upper mesh panels for ventilation made this tent hot in no time.. bad design, probably the "brilliant idea" of some accountant that thought "this will save the company a bunch of money"! So much for that... My previous Coleman tent lasted ~6 years of going on many trips with kids, I don't see how this one would last half as much.
customer_reviews.author: Racecar Fabricator

customer_reviews.title: I was tempted to forgo a refund so I could set it on fire & delight in watching it burn !
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd read the other reviews before purchasing this ! 3 hours of our lives wasted trying to erect this tent only to figure out that it would be impossible because many of the poles sections and joints were assembled incorrectly AT THE FACTORY ! Took another 30 minutes to get it folded back into a shape to get it into the bag. COLEMAN: Whatever manufacturing plant this was made at has HORRIBLE QUALITY CONTROL ! Quite possibly one of the WORST product experiences I've had in the last decade !
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent, roomy and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. I wanted to use it a couple times before reviewing, and we have. The first time setting up took us a few minutes to figure out so we had it up in like 10 minutes or so. But that was our fault since we didn't read the instructions first, thought we would just wing it. The second time was much quicker, just a couple minutes. The only down side is it is a little heavy and hard to get in the bag when you take it down, but that's just because of the poles being attached. It's to be expected though since it is a large tent. I don't regret getting it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fanatastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 1 week camping trip in southern Ms Lumberton. March weather is always wonky in southern Ms and We try to prepare for everything. Thursday nite March 14th the camp site had Heavy rain and winds up to 45 mph. The tent withstood it all. I would suggest in the video of how it goes up to include taking it down and stuffing it back into the back. The stakes got lost unpacking the tent but a friend had long curled dog chain holders and they didn't even wiggle a little free. For someone with handicaps this tent was so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Geni Mac

customer_reviews.title: The one I got wasn’t rainproof at all. Bad stitching!!
customer_reviews.text: Very bad stitching job, caused it to leak rain thru the pockets And every wall. Everyone and everything in the tent got soaked we just lost the money for the campsite and went home early. It’s sets up in one minute just like they say, it takes down just as fast. It’s a great tent and good size. I am going to return this one and buy another one. If it’s any better I’ll update the review!
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes Autos Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time or energy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Something is not quite right with the design of this tent! This tent was bought for a family camping trip. We tried setting it up before trip. Could not get the legs to work right. 1 leg was bent could not get it out of slider leg. Called amazon they were very helpful sent out another one ASAP. Got that one, try to set it up same problems with the legs. Seems like legs are on backwards! Really NOT WORTH THE HEADACKS! Thank you amazon! We were very happy with customer service 😃 Not happy with Coleman’s (not so) 8 persons instant tent
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth Giantonio

customer_reviews.title: Need better quality assurance and strong parts
customer_reviews.text: Couple off rings, which should hold space dividers & windows inside tent, got ripped off on the FIRST TIME USE. Got so frustrated right after setup the tent at campsite. Also no idea why the rainfly does not come with the tent. It's sold as SEPARATELY and have to pay extra $45+tax. Also as other reviews, you should be VERY CAREFUL when you install tents since all connected parts are easy-breakable plastic pieces as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Came assembled incorrectly and broken. I Cant describe how sad I am about this tent. Did a lot of research and comparison to see which tent would fit best for my family and I. Read some reviews about sub par construction quality and I figured it wouldnt happen to me. Well, it did. The arm on one of the supports is bent and assembled backwards causing it to break. It wont erect correctly be cause of this. I work hard for my money and wanted to splurge a little on something nice that we can make memories with. Maybe with a different tent but this busted thing ain't gonna cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice big tent, but significant concerns about quality and workmanship
customer_reviews.text: This tensor does very well for three or four camping trips. It is very easy to set up and pack up. The last time we used it, one of the poles got stuck. I was able to make it work yes, but yesterday we went camping and I could not get the pole to slide. I was on an island, and when the pole wooden slide, I couldn't disassemble the tent at all. I ended up having to throw it away at the campsite because I had no way to bring it back how's it's pretty big. All this is to say that while this is a good tent oh, I'm really not very confident about the workmanship and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Geller

customer_reviews.title: I loved this tent until a storm came an one of ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tent until a storm came an one of the top joints piped. This is not covered in the warranty. The person I dealt with at Voleman could tell me if the piece I ordered would be the right piece. Then I was told this is not covered by the 1 year coverage. Cost to mail this 2.99 piece was 5.99. As a Longtime customer if their products I am very disappointed that the charged me for a piece that should have been under warranty. I will think twice when time to buy more equipment. Very unhappy - at least train your customer service folks which parts are which.
customer_reviews.author: Lilli Ann Hall

customer_reviews.title: its a beast!
customer_reviews.text: I officially named this tent the "Hotel" Its HUGE! Wayyy too much for a dad and a kid. Downsizing to the 6man. It was very nice to have all that space but on cold nights if you dont have a good sleeping bag or lots of blankets, it gets very chilly. Also, the whole set-up and break down in a few mins... BS! took about 10mins to fully setup and about the same to take down. Theres a ton of material and just doesnt pop-up or fold down as quick as the video shows. However, for a large family... like 5+... Probably the best tent ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up for this tent!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tent because our old tent was becoming just too difficult to put up and take down. This model was recommended to us by a friend. Although we didn't get it up in 5 minutes, we had it up in about 15 which was much faster and easier than our previous tent. So I give it a thumbs up! They call it an 8 person tent, which means it was perfect for the two of us. We liked the roominess. Even with our queen size air mattress, we had plenty of room for our suitcases and little night stands. Plus there was room to set up our camp chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Alene R.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tent
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and simple to operate tent, the space is big enough, my two children can jump around and jump, the most satisfactory is that there is no wind entering after the curtains are pulled up, unlike the tents I bought before, there is a big net. It was too cold to sleep at night, the only thing was a little too heavy. If no one helped, it would be difficult to put it in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: XIAOQIN

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as it looks
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent with much enthusiasm after seeing the video and the reviews only to find some of poles were not going into position and having to force it to connect. come to find out that the many of the poles and fasteners were Installed incorrectly. We bought it during Black Friday and didn’t use it for 9 months but it was too late to return ..Its a good tent if they manufacture correctly but I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Corner hinges break and no replacement parts available
customer_reviews.text: The third time I used this tent, the plastic hinge corner piece at the edge of the roofline broke. This happened when I was just putting up the tent without forcing anything. If you research it, you'll see many complaints about this flaw – if you own this tent, it'll happen to you. Unfortunately Coleman no longer sells the replacement part (#501000851) you'll be left with a $200 piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: No more instant tents for me.
customer_reviews.text: It was an awesome tent for two years. I bought it in 2017. 2019 one of the metal buttons that pop out to hold the leg in place once extended broke and popped out completely, so now the tent stands lopsided. I guess I could use something to stick in there to keep that leg extended but I have since moved on to a better tent. No more instant tents for me.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised to see that having a big tent for car camping is WAY better! This tent has a great feature of having ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this tent. We have always used smaller backpacking-style tents for camping. I was worried this would feel too big, I was surprised to see that having a big tent for car camping is WAY better! This tent has a great feature of having the front be like a screened in porch, which could be nice if you're in a buggy places and the back can be more private for changing and sleeping. We love this tent and it was easy to put up. It stood up to some good ocean wind and a powerful rain storm.
customer_reviews.author: Tenzin

customer_reviews.title: Bad Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the tent a few years ago and used it 2-3 times each year. Recently, while camping one of the corner joints snapped. Although the tent is still available, Coleman discontinued the part and it's no longer available. I'd never buy it again. It's easy to put up, but does not last and parts are now discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: DCC

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent, taller people can stand up in it
customer_reviews.text: Really does set up quickly. Did not have the problems that some people experienced in other reviews. Love the big screens at the one end. there is a room divider curtain making this 2 rooms. A bit tight for 8 people but very spacious for 2. My husband is 6' tall and can stand up easily inside with room to spare for taller people. Based on other reviews we purchased Star Brite Waterproofing spray (1 gallon) and used it straight with a sprayer (have 1 quart left) Note: wear a mask. Also based on reviews I purchased heavier duty tent stakes and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Lane

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made. I ordered two of these tents ...
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made. I ordered two of these tents and had to return them both. The first was assembled wrong at the factory where they forced the square side of a pole to go into the round side of the connecting pole. The second one broke during setup. The small bolt that connects one of the leg poles to the joint snapped.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin R. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: How it does with rain
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I should give this five stars because I don't think any tent can be completely waterproof. My first use, I spend a week in it and had heavy down pores the second day and through the night. There were just a few small spots of water that got in but overall, I was very impressed given the amount of rain. I LOVED that I didn't have to put a rain fly on. The tent is very roomy and I could easily walk around in it without ducking. Well done Coleman!!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Get it for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This tent shines ONLY if you get it for a good price. I got it for almost $300 on Amazon then the day I received it, it was on sale for $190. I called and asked for a refund for the difference and got it. If that haven't happened I would be dissatisfied with my purchase. The product is okay and actually sets up pretty quick, it's just huge which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Dill

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March of 2016. I wanted to use it before writing a review. I love this thing. I can have it up and down by myself in about 10-15 minutes(not including stakes and guy lines), even quicker when I have help. It returns to the bag easily every time. I haven't had any leaks yet and we've been in a few rain storms. I did invest in the fly this summer and would recommend it. I like how it basically can turn into a screen tent when it gets steamy out. Worth the money for me and my family.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN CAHILL

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this tent!!! I had the same one before and it lasted at least 7 years. I keep it up all summer and take it down when I go camping. Other wise it probably would last forever if I just used it for camping only. Just remember to spray waterproofing on it every year. It withstands heavy winds and rain. Very roomy and nice tent. Very easy to put up with 2 people. I usually do it myself, but then you have to worry about the poles bending out of shape just a little. That's OK! It still did the job!
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: East to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this tent is awesome. My biggest complain is that for some reason on my tent the middle poles on either side do not touch the ground even after being fully extended. Not sure if its a fault with my specific tent or all of them. tent is a nice construction, easy to get in and out of. We were able to put in a queen size mattress and had a single person cot and still plenty of room to walk around and stand Other than that went on a 3 night camping trip with the family and everyone loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Khurrum Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Returned it the day we received it
customer_reviews.text: Received this tent yesterday and returned it yesterday. We set it up in our front yard just to get a feel for it. Easy to put up, sure.... but the quality of the tent is just not good for us. The two middle poles don’t even reach the ground, and we were on a flat surface. It was a little windy in our yard, and practically blew it down. I don’t think it would withstand a super windy camping trip. And the back side that unzips, has a hole where three zippers meet, that rain would for sure get into the tent and soak the floor through there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Spacious and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This tent is going to be great! I say going to because we haven’t taken it out for real camping yet. So far we have only backyard camped, but from that experience I can tell we love this tent. First of all it is a little on the heavier side, but was very easy to set up and take down, (with two people). Once it is up it is easy to see how spacious and comfortable this tent is. We were able to fit a queen blow up and two twin blow up beds with plenty of room to spare. So far I recommend this tent. I will know for sure after the tents first real camping trip this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Erik D

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this tent
customer_reviews.text: 2 years into it and the plastic joint on the pole is broken. They do not make the tent anymore, they do not make the replacement parts for it. I spoke with Coleman directly and they are unwilling to help. It comes with only a 1 year warranty. Avoid this crappy product. The tent is useless after 2 years of lightweight use. Major thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Good vendor, bad product.
customer_reviews.text: THEY LIED !! THIS TENT GOT WET IN A DRIZZLE. I set up rain fly, tethered down all stays and water rolled in. I had even 3M'd the entire seamed top! VERY heavy, Very Large and Very non waterproof. I mean a drizzle and the inside on a flat surface had water pouring in! I got a refund. But I had a hell of a time repackaging. Vendor was good in timely refund, not their fault product failed.
customer_reviews.author: MERYXMRS

customer_reviews.title: Nice and big but it leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Not water prove! The tent is nice and really big. I'm 6'4 and can stand on inside without issues. If is going to rain, make sure to have the rain fly. In my opinion, it should be included for free and they should not charge you 40 for it. It's nice but it does leak.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately the quality didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: In the end, I've been disappointed. We've used the tent twice over the last six months, and the buttons that click in place to hold poles have already broken out in two places making the tent unusable. I love the concept of an instant tent, but this one just didn't last long enough for me to feel it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: We love it, just a couple flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Love the easy setup.. the shape.. the size.. the zipper is really annoying. It gets caught easily. Condensation on the ceiling, will have to purchase something for the roof. SUPER heavy. With that being said WE LOVE OUR TENT AND HAVE NO REGRETS!!
customer_reviews.author: cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Received a tent with major manufacturer defects.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad I received a defective tent. Two of the top telescoping rods were installed upside-down (top side is supposed to be rounded, bottom side flat), not allowing them to to move. The other two worked well, but were crooked where the metal latch pops out. Also, one of the middle side telescoping rods weren't able to extend far enough to be latched. It was near impossible to fold together due to the manufacturer defects, but I managed to fasten a box to return this. I won't be taking a chance on purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, but hard to get back in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: My brother had taken an archeology trip a few weeks ago, and said that it took 2 people to put up, but it was a nice size to fit all of his equipment he needed for the trip. The tent material was of good quality and held up to the wind in the evening. The only drawback was trying to get it folded back up to fit the carrier. They need to make them more user friendly on taking down a tent, this one was half hanging out of the bag with two people trying to stuff it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C Draper

customer_reviews.title: Great camping tent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! It is SO roomy inside. I can stand straight (I'm 5'9") and reach my hands up and stretch without any problems. It fits two queen size air mattresses and still has room to walk around. I don't think it would fit another air mattress in it, but I could probably fit a cot or a couple of sleeping bags. It takes a lot longer than a minute to set up (LOL), and it definitely takes a lot of effort to pack back up, but it's worth it! This tent has transformed our camping for the better. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Yvi MC

customer_reviews.title: like new?
customer_reviews.text: I like a deal as much as anyone, and when I saw this tent in the used section advertised as "like new", I went for it even though it was expensive. Long story short, it was defective and could not be set up OR packaged back. The poles would not open completely, and then stuck and would not close. Could not be used at all.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Quick up - but it's heavy!
customer_reviews.text: We used this the past weekend - took all of 60 seconds to set up! HUGE fan! Has a TON of room, we actually kicked the kids out into their own tent, set up a mattress on a frame and make it our OWN get a way tent!! :) The only down side it's really darn heavy and it didn't come with a rain fly. (which i thought that it did) Over all highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put this tent up once. It worked well enough, except that one of the extensible "arms" (confusing term) did not extend. Major problems came when it came time to take it down. Two of the other "arms" refused to collapse - I had to bang them with a hammer until the fabric tore. Trying to set it up again in my back yard to clean it, none of the arms would extend. It has been sitting there now for days, a big pile of useless poles and fabric.
customer_reviews.author: James Gasperini

customer_reviews.title: Great tent with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for easy setup and take down. This was an upgrade from the smaller 4 person version. I got this one so I could fit a queen size cot. It is heavy and big for storing. The poles can sometimes take a bit of effort to extend and collapse. Door zipper takes 2 hands to open and close. During a bad rain storm the door wasn't closed well and water got in even though we have the additional rain fly. Overall works well for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this tent, with being an avid camper, I've had the same traditional 8 person tent for years, but decided to upgrade this year-- big mistake! They advertise 30 second set up, more like 2 hrs! The directions were crappy and not clear. The windows were nice but it had doors on both sides instead of in the front. That really cuts down on the size. My advice for anyone who's thinking this is an upgrade compared to a $140 8 person rent will be very disappointed. Don't waste your money. I'd totally return it if I could, but it's hard now it's all dusty and cant even fit into it's own damn bag.
customer_reviews.author: D'anndrea Hill

customer_reviews.title: Never buying Coleman products again
customer_reviews.text: Two of the telescoping poles came misassembled from the factory and were inoperable. I received two replacement poles from Coleman that came disassembled with no way to assemble them without factory equipment. Customer service offered me a free tent, but it wouldn't be here in time for my camping trip. I expect this kind of quality from a knockoff manufacturer and not from a name brand I trusted for years. Because of this experience, I will never buy another Coleman product again. They don't seem to care about quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room for us.
customer_reviews.text: A very roomy tent. We had 6 of us in it and no-one felt cramped. The setup took about 10 minutes as we figured it out, but it was stupidly simple once we did. Take down was another 10 minutes. The walls are super thin, but they do their job and there's PLENTY of windows. This was the first tent in a decade that didn't have a screened ceiling so condensation was an issue first thing this morning, but it evaporated once the sun started getting hot. Overall a very good purchase for big camping events - it's a bit heavy for dragging out for anything less than 5 people... in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Coleman makes junk
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent twice and now it is worthless. The extension arms on the top have plastic cuffs that twist and cause the bottom legs to twist and turn making it a nightmare to try and set up. Then once set up, it’s a nightmare to stake and keep up. I am done with Coleman products. The last few items I have purchased are low quality and junk. They don’t care because they are such a big company, but I can assure you that should you buy their products you will eventually be let down and frustrated. Camping products need to be reliable when you are vulnerable in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: Mucho_Martini

customer_reviews.title: Tent is NOT Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This tent says that you do not need a rain fly. The first time we used it it rained - we had 3" of water in the tent. So we purchased the rain fly thinking that would solve the problem, no such luck. The next time we used it, it rained again and once again we had 1-3" of water in the tent. This tent goes up and down very easily but I would never recommend using it if it is going to rain. Very disappointed in this Coleman product. We sent everything back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Weber

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up/ good quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are regular campers and have owned, and still own, many different tents for different campouts. This tent is really amazingly easy to set up. The two of can pop it up in 5 minutes. It certainly isn't a tent to take if you're sharing smaller camp sites with others, but if you're able to have a bigger space, this is a good option. My husband is 6'4" and can't stand inside without stopping. It's big enough that several people could hangout inside if it were to rain. My only complaint is that the rain fly had to be purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to set up as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to set up as advertised. Issue was all of the poles were stuck in the retracted position. I ended up having to basically squat each pole to get them to extend and lock (and I'm a big dude.. do free weights several times a week). Way too much friction or something. Maybe it will be loosened up now that I fought through it once. Did not include tent stakes, luckily I had read other reviews and thought the stakes it was supposed to include were going to be useless so I bought better ones ahead of time. Once up it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase this tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent was purchased in June 2018. During the second use, the pictured screw that holds two poles together snapped. After contacting Coleman they indicated they do not have a replacement part. Therefore this tent is useless. I thought Coleman had a good name and reputation. Obviously this isn't the case. Unfortunately Amazon return time ended August 18th. Since a tent isn't something you use everyday that timeframe is pretty short. I am very disappointed with this purchase. If I could give it a zero rating I would.
customer_reviews.author: Katb

customer_reviews.title: This tent was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent was very easy to set up! It goes up in a couple of minutes where my other tent takes at least ten minutes, this one took maybe two. The only downside is that I cannot take it down alone. Oh, I can get it all collapsed, but to put the bars in upright positions and swirls the tent bottom around it so I can lay it down, roll it up and put it in is bag? No way, Jose. I always have to have help, but that's okay too. Overall a great buy, and much easier to do alone than the $300 tent I have.
customer_reviews.author: Briarly

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent but I am warning you
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent but I am warning you, you better put it up before you go camping with it and when all else fails, READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. Also, just like every tent I have ever bought or been given, they never fit back into their bag the first time and this one is no exception. So, a word to the wise, put it up, take it down, and put it into its bag several times before you go camping. That way you will know how to proceed.. The stakes are steel but small.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: FAILURE after 3 uses.  Plus, useless in rain
customer_reviews.text: DISASTER!!! On the third use FAILURE. One of the leg hinges broke for NO GOOD REASON. I never beat it up, threw it around, or forced anything. And there was no good way to rig it. I ended up hanging the broken leg over the frame of someone else's tent just to be able to use the tent for the weekend (since I was 6 hours from home). DISASTER!!!! Also, in the rain, when you unzip the doors, water floods in, even with the rain fly. It is because the walls of the tent lean in from bottom to top. So as water sheds, if your door is open, it sheds inside. Big design flaw. Returning to Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Running Mom

customer_reviews.title: No stakes, poles won’t extend and broken zippier
customer_reviews.text: This looks great once it’s up but that took me some additional work. I have put many tents up and this one was by far the worst. First, I took the tent out and no stakes! Then the tops on the top would not extend. I had to buy a wrench to twist the poles so it would extend. Lastly, I get it all up and a zipper is broken. Uuuuuggggghhhh. I still have a Coleman tent from 2001 and use it! Why can’t they all come this way????
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today.  First Impressions.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup. Rainfly looks great. After reading other reviews I was a little hesitant. One complaint was that it was hard to unzip with one hand. There are ground stake loops underneath where the zippers meet. Put those in and one hand unzipping is no problem. Another complaint was that the window flaps don't tie-down and don't roll down all the way. All you need to do is roll the flaps up and tuck them into the screen-facing pocket. No tie-downs needed. I still need to camp in it to give further feedback but I'm super impressed with this tent. Looking forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I’ve ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this tent for over 7 years and I can’t say how much we still enjoy this tent, from local lake camping to long weeks in the Red Wood forest, we’ve taken this tent up and down the coast and had zero issues with it, it sets up so fast, extra thick siding material keeps it from ripping where other tents rip after a year or two, it’s still the only tent that ever fits back into its original bag too without going crazy trying to stuff in back inside!! Worth every penny spent if not more!!
customer_reviews.author: John Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Owned this tent for over 2 years now. Only needed to use it on a handle full of occasions but each for 4 or more days in areas with regular strong trade winds. Very happy with the purchase. It really does setup and brake down easy. Like anything your folding back up we are not always sure how to fold the material but the elbows and pins all work as they should and we never have a problem getting it back in the bag. I would recommend this tent and purchase again if we need another big one.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleo Puaa

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Camping Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6-person family has used this tent several times over the past three years and we love it. Lots of room inside, durable, easy and fast to put up and take down. I purchased theto go with it and would strongly recommend using it for added rain protection. Also get stronger stakes likefor better anchoring, the stakes that come with the tent are inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Nice Weather, Not So Perfect if Any Wind
customer_reviews.text: We had a few problems. The set up wasnt as easy as the video or instructions. We had a slight wind which made assembly difficult. When the wind was more constant, three of the legs bent, making it impossible to disassemble or use again. We used it once. Now we will try to use only some of the legs. Its a perfect tent for nice weather but slight wind, not so nice :( The legs being attached to the tent was nice but its a bulky product.
customer_reviews.author: not a Diva

customer_reviews.title: Best tent we have gotten
customer_reviews.text: Best tent we have gotten. ALOT of room, I can stand in side and still have plenty of head space 5'10" 2 rooms, great for camping with friends. each room as its own door out. The huge windows give so much air movement its amazing for hot summer nights, think south FL swamps. Even with the heavy rains of south FL we were perfectly dry no water inside at all. you can also buy an optional rain cover so you can keep the windows open while its raining so you stay dry and nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Coldtags

customer_reviews.title: WOULD BUY IT AGAIN  ... !!!!
customer_reviews.text: HAVE BEEN USING IT FOR SEVERAL MONTHS , WOULD BUY IT AGAIN , I PUT HEAVY GAUGE METAL SHELVING ON THREE SIDES OF IT , AND WILL PUT 2 X 4 S ON TOP OF THE SHELVING TO USE AS A FRAMEWORK TO HOLD A LARGE TARP FOR WINTER USE , THERE IS ICE AND SNOW HERE IN THE WINTER ...
customer_reviews.author: Frank Stivers

customer_reviews.title: NOT rainproof!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a camper so this might be common knowledge to other people, but the person number on each tent is if only bodies are in the tent...nothing else. We had 2 adults, 3 children, cot, sleeping bags, luggage/bags (4-5 day trip), etc. We needed a 12 person tent to be comfortable. And the tent is NOT rain proof by itself! You MUST have the rain tarp/cover. A random storm came & water was seeping into the tent as we slept. Luckily my husband got the cover up before the massive downpour after it started raining.
customer_reviews.author: Kiara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for two queen mattresses luxury camping.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for two queen size air mattresses. Heavy and a bit bulky to put away but very simple to setup and take down. Make sure you get the 14x10 rainfly and not the 14x8. I did a combo most frequently purchases and it was wrong size. The right size is almost twice the price, so go figure. Otherwise this is a great tent for luxury camping. Picture is with wrong rainfly.
customer_reviews.author: DV NYC

customer_reviews.title: Try it before first use!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Excellent space, great airflow, and holds heat decently. However upon first use there was a manufacturers error where one of the legs was installed upside down, making it unable to fully extend. Unfortunately had to use it in this half pitched state while camping for that week but was able to unscrew the leg and turn it around after the trip. Have not pitched the tent since but I'm sure it will be even better now that it works.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Easy to put up, takes about five minutes, no poles to insert, just pull out the poles and snap into place and really like how the one end is screened which can be completely enclosed as well. It lightly rained during one of my summer camping trips and no leaks. Also, the Coleman big screened area tent is very nice too to keep your food and table in and keep flies out. Great products!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: It's a camping mansion!  Best tent I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for the first time this weekend. It's not a tent--it's a camping mansion! Very easy to set up--two of us had it up and staked into the ground within 5 to 10 minutes. Took the advice of a couple of reviewers and purchased 12" heavy duty stakes. Very happy we used those as it was windy when we woke up Sunday morning. The height of the tent allows most adults to stand straight up while in the tent. Love this tent! Allows you to spend more time hiking, kayaking, etc., and very little time putting the tent up at your campsite. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: HSTfan

customer_reviews.title: Camping is In-Tents (tense)!
customer_reviews.text: Tents have come a long way since my scouting days. This tent is very easy to set up. There are no poles to slide into a sleeve as it is all set already. You just have to lock out the poles. It is very spacious inside and tall, and it can hold 8 people, of course it would be crowded if you get everyone in there with all their stuff.. I was afraid folding it up would be a nightmare but if you follow the instructions and remember how you first unfolded it, it folds up very easy. I was glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Gibble Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great tent (needs a porch though)
customer_reviews.text: Used this once so far. Had some rain and everything stayed dry (although we did get the additional rain fly) Goes up FAST. I'm 6'3" and moving around inside this tent is great. I would've given 5 Stars but for the fact that when its raining it is impossible not to get some water inside when entering or exiting the tent. Some sort of porch area would've been nice - I wish they sold an add-on one for this tent. I'll try to Macgyver something with a tarp next time.
customer_reviews.author: Bendra

customer_reviews.title: but the door designs were poor if it rains out
customer_reviews.text: Tent was ok, but the door designs were poor if it rains out. Both doors will leak on you if you don't pay close attention to zippers being zipped tight. I bought this tent used it twice before the "instant set" pole system broke. It's a very good idea but they haven't quite figured it out, it is way to weak of a system. $350 tent that is now in the garbage after spending 5 nights in it. Called Coleman for replacement parts (willing to pay for them) and said they don't sell them separate. Very frustrated, for what sounds like a common problem on their tents they don't offer parts to fix it. Would not recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Not a two room tent!
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I have spent 30 days of camping in this tent and the biggest complaint is that the divider in the middle of the tent that is supposed to make it two rooms is not attached on the sides (there is about a 4-6" space between the side and the curtain) and it stops at least a foot from the floor. The divider is almost useless for anything. Too much open space for privacy and not "sealed" enough to use the front as a screened in porch and the back as a separate room. I read close to a hundred reviews and no one mentioned what I feel is an important feature.
customer_reviews.author: drakeyj

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE TENT EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are frequent campers & have tents for all different seasons. This is by far ONE OF OUR FAVORITE TENTS EVER!!! It is extremely easy to set up and incredibly roomy inside. We have 2 twin XL air matresses, 2 large duffels and an entertainment station that we set up inside and we still have room to move around. The tent has also withstood several rainstorms with no water leakage. LOVE, LOVE this little 'home away from home'!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Lemaire

customer_reviews.title: Setup in 3 minutes, without reading directions. Super easy.
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to setup. The poles are pre-attaches, telescoping, and self-locking. Took me 3 minutes flat to setup, first time without reading directions. Make sure you buy the rainfly, it doesn’t come with it. I’d also get a tarp for beneath, the floor of the tent isn’t as thick as I’ve seen in other brands. Still, awesome. Perfect for a family to share.
customer_reviews.author: kc1979

customer_reviews.title: Great idea killed by low quality
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to set up! A great idea that's killed by very, very low quality materials. The 2nd time we set up this tent, two of the "joints" broke. I suppose I could find replacement parts and repair it myself. But what's the point if it breaks the next time I use it? Here's what I learned. Maybe the idea of an "instant tent" is a bit foolish. Maybe there's a reason other tents are put together in the traditional way. Avoid this tent...seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Davidjhonda

customer_reviews.title: when it rains, it pours.
customer_reviews.text: Trial by fire, or water as it were... We went out on a clear and lovely spring weekend in the Arizona mountains. Forecast of sun with chance of even more sun. No need for a rain fly, no need to weather seal the seams, right? It rained all weekend with a side of nasty hail for good measure. Inside the tent, no seamseal and no rainfly, we stayed dry and warm. And when it came time to put it all up, we had the whole thing packed and stowed I. The trunk in less than five minutes. Love the new tent. Looove it.
customer_reviews.author: the goat

customer_reviews.title: roomy tent and great in fair weather
customer_reviews.text: roomy tent and great in fair weather. I wouldn't recommend this in a rainy environment without a rainfly which unfortunately it doesnt come with. Condensation builds up in on the roof of the tent and it is wet to the touch on the inside but there were no puddles or moisture on the floor. you absolutely have to stake this tent down or else it will be flimsy but when properly staked down it held up nicely on a windy day when I used it. I used a tarp to put over it on the one time it rained when I used it and everything stayed dry. If it had a rain fly I would probably give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jake thomas

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing tent! We have had ours 2 seasons now ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing tent! We have had ours 2 seasons now and love it. After tenting for 10+ years, and normally spending hours setting up our campsite, this thing was a revolution. It is so easy to set up and seems pretty durable. Putting it away is pretty decent too as the bag it comes with is extended, unlike most other tents. We have had a few scary windy days where most tents would be destroyed, but we just drop down the side poles, and then push it inwards so it's flat and that really helped. Stronly recommend this tent for anyone who tents regularly and wants something easy to put up and take down and with good room.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarskoota

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very glad I tried to set this tent up at home before going on my annual fishing trip! Poor quality control on the construction of this tent. When I received it, 2 of the attached tent poles were inverted. It came that way from the Coleman factory. Nearly snapped one of the poles trying to set it up the first time! Be very cautious and inspect it carefully if you purchase this product... I will say I have been using Coleman camping gear for better than 20 years and this is the first time I have purchased one of their products that was in this condition... I'll be wary of buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Huebner

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a larger carrying bag to slide in more easily would be beneficial
customer_reviews.text: One of the poles kept getting stuck. The tent in the bag is bulky and heavy for me and I am a strong female. I was attending a camp with 100 people. My male friend was new at putting up the tent and taking it down . Initially, there were a few challenges. We always clean the tent at home before storing it away. The tent was up in 5-7 mins and down in 5 as advertised. Maybe a larger carrying bag to slide in more easily would be beneficial. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: we have only used this for one camp trip so far and will be again in a few days,but so far it has held up great. Roomy too. We were able to fit 2 adults, 3 kids and our mmedium breed dog and her crate inside with room to spare for clothes,changing,etc.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this tent, poorly designed.!.!
customer_reviews.text: If you're in an area with small snakes and insects don't buy this tent, the doors do not completely close. Coleman has gone away from the D style door which is the best seal you're going to get in a tent. They've now started using T or L style door where two separate zippers come together at a point and it is a horrible design.
customer_reviews.author: KEV

customer_reviews.title: ***Make a better choice***
customer_reviews.text: I owned a different version of this tent and know how to set it up. I unboxed this one at the campground assuming it would be perfect. After an hour of trying to figure out why it would not extend it ended up in the dumpster of the campsite. Was so angry didn't even bother trying to stuff it back into the bag to deal with a return. Could be my worst amazon purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: TRM

customer_reviews.title: Return Policy is Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant with keeping the tent after noticing errors in workmanship of seams and stains. After testing it in the backyard, It leaked from just a light rain. The return policy with Amazon Prime was fast and outstanding!! Got on Amazon website, click exchange, replacement ordered, and select option to return first tent. This was done on a Saturday!! UPS picked up the return tent on following Monday at my house, and delivered the exchange tent the next day. Quality of material was noticeable on both tents but workmanship makes the difference. The second tent passed the test. I'm well pleased with Coleman and Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Leber

customer_reviews.title: Fast but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is a spacious tent and quick to set up. However, the pole system jams easily (I've had to request a replacement tent, as did a friend of mine), and the material on the floor is as thin as the walls. It comes with very flimsy stakes and no rain fly, so if you camp much, you will want to purchase both, as well as a tarp to put under the floor. Coleman customer service is fine with replacing the tent (without having to ship the heavy thing back), so they are aware of its tendency to jam. Hoping for better luck with the next one -- or maybe I'll have to replace it for each trip.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: My wife is disappointed at ME!
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to install as they say. I had to get better stakes so that the wind wouldn't blow it apart. Water bleeds through the material quite easily. I have to mop up Everytime there is rain.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Easiest tent in the world to set up
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of pop-up tent it is the easiest tent in the world to set up I love how it's a big Square tent once it is set up it actually feels like a big tent I've had to divider wall down the center of the tent come in handy more than once
customer_reviews.author: spencer

product_meta.title: Coleman 8-Person Tent | Instant Family Tent
product_meta.description: Enjoy room for the whole family to spread out in the Coleman 8-Person Instant Tent. This camping tent is designed to set up in about a minute in three easy steps. Simply unfold the tent, extend the poles, and secure them. Stay dry thanks to the WeatherTec system that features thick waterproof walls and patented welded floors with inverted seams to help keep water out. Large screened windows and doors let you enjoy your view of the outdoors while keeping bugs out. This 8-person tent offers enough room for two queen size air beds and comes with a room divider to create some privacy.
feature_bullets: Spacious 8-person tent has enough room for 2 queen size air beds
Sets up in 1 minute in 3 easy steps
WeatherTec system with patented welded floors and inverted seams to keep you dry
Large screened windows and doors keep bugs out
Measures 14 x 10 feet with 6-foot 7-inch center height

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
